content:
They use two different asddress books the collected addresses book Vs Personal address book. But do you have write access to the address book you are trying to add the contact to?

Press Ctrl+ Shift + J and have a look in the error console immediately after you attempt to save the new contact. once the console is open, clear it using the icon on its toolbar so other spurious error reports do not confuse the issue. Getting mail generally triggers quite a few of them for instance and we are interested here only in the result of the save attempts.
creator: MattAuSupport

content: Thanks for speedy response Matt. Strangely, I just cleared the error console log as you said, and tried adding the contact and then it worked fine. I don't really understand that, but it's working again. Thanks for your input. Mike

content:
1. They should be in the Trash folder unless you deleted them from there.

2. Yes, the folder can be deleted without losing the messages.
creator: siffemoz

content:
grahamgarden said
2 Can the Search folder and the copies of the messages in it be deleted without loosing them from the Original folder?

The following link might be helpful: Using Saved Searches https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/using-saved-searches

Quotations from the above link:

Actions on the messages shown in a Saved Search folder will apply directly to your original messages in the source folders.
NOTE: Saved Searches display the actual matching messages of the source folders, not copies of those messages. Deleting messages in a Saved Search folder will remove them from Thunderbird entirely and normally also from the server of your email provider. However, deleting the Saved Search folder itself from the folder list will not remove the original messages it was displaying. So you can delete any Saved Searches you no longer need without having to worry about losing your messages.
creator: Yu5tiqX9og

content: If you're using Gmail, you might find it in the Trash or All Mail folder when logged into Gmail via the web interface.
creator: siffemoz

content: You may have a version of Thunderbird with the buggy account hub. Go into Settings > General, disable the account hub, and try again to set up accounts.
creator: mozilla98

content: Are these all with the same domain? What error messages are you receiving? Without more info, no one can assist. thank you
creator: davidsk

content:
If you disable the hub and still cannot set up an account, please share specific error messages.

If the account works in another e-mail client, you may need an app-specific password for Thunderbird. Who is your e-mail service provider?

Of course, double check all incoming and outgoing server settings against what the server requires.
creator: mozilla98
